data.chText: 极糟糕的；灾难性的；完全失败的
严重歉收 / 火灾；灾难性的结果

data.enText: Lowering interest rates could have disastrous consequences for the economy.
data.chText: 降低利率可能给经济带来灾难性后果。

data.enText: How could everything go so disastrously wrong?
data.chText: 怎么会事事都出这么大的错呢？

tr: (of events) having extremely unfortunate or dire consequences
example: the stock market crashed on Black Friday
the battle was a disastrous end to a disastrous campaign
such doctrines, if true, would be absolutely fatal to my theory"- Charles Darwi
it is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it"- Douglas MacArthu

example.ex: The effect on coffee prices has been disastrous for the producers.
example.tran: 对咖啡价格的影响对生产商而言是灾难性的。

value.def: A disastrous event has extremely bad consequences and effects.

example.ex: The vegetable harvest is disastrously behind schedule...
example.tran: 蔬菜收获比预期时间晚了很多，造成了严重后果。

example.ex: England's cricketers have had another disastrous day.
example.tran: 英格兰板球队又经历了灰色的一天。

example.ex: ...their disastrous performance in the general election of 1906.
example.tran: 他们在1906大选中的糟糕表现

value.def: If you describe something as disastrous, you mean that it was very unsuccessful.

example.ex: ...the company's disastrously timed venture into property development.
example.tran: 公司对房地产开发完全不合时宜的冒进

partsOfSpeech.dec: con- 共同,一起 + sci 知道 + -ous ...的
e- 向外,离开 + norm 规则 + -ous ...的
ob- 加强 + vi 道路 + -ous ...的

partsOfSpeech.d: 上一次的, 上一个的

partsOfSpeech.dec: trem- 颤抖 + end n.最后部分 + -ous ...的
an- 否定 + onym 名字 + -ous ...的
super- 超过 + flu 流动 + -ous ...的
gorge 装饰喉咙的东西 + -ous ...的
mono- 单个 + ton 声 + -ous ...的
con- 共同,一起 + spic 看 + -u- + -ous ...的

partsOfSpeech.d: 传染性的，感染的(尤指通过呼吸)
